item.title: Cumulus
item.description:
Cumulus is a cloud-based single-cell and single-nucleus RNA-Seq data analysis framework that is scalable, cost-effective, able to process a variety of data types and easily accessible to biologists. It is developed based on Google Cloud Platform and Broad Institute’s FireCloud and Terra services, and is publicly accessible. Cumulus source codes contain two components. The first component consists of WDL (Workflow Description Language) files and Docker files that are required for workflow execution and listed here. The second component is a Python package Pegasus for analyzing gene-count matrices.

Click here to read Cumulus documentation

  • Manuscript in preparation.

item.title: Pegasus
item.description:
Pegasus is a python package that takes gene-count matrices as input and performs a wide range of analyses, such as –

  • Quality control;
  • Highly variable gene selection;
  • Batch correction;
  • Principal component analysis (PCA);
  • k-nearest neighbor (kNN) graph construction;
  • Diffusion map;
  • Community-graph based clustering;
  • Visualization on t-SNE, UMAP, and force-directed layout (FLE) embeddings;
  • Differential expression, cluster-specific marker detection;
  • Marker-based cell type annotation.

Click here to read Pegasus documentation.

Pegasus is released on PyPI as a Python package.

Publications:

  • Manuscript in preparation.

item.title: PROBer
item.description:
PROBer is the first unified probabilistic framework for the analysis of a diverse set of sequencing-based ‘toeprinting’ assays. These assays are used to probe RNA secondary structure (DMS/SHAPE-Seq), detect epitranscriptomic mark (Pseudo-Seq), or identify RNA-protein interaction (iCLIP/eCLIP), which are important to understanding post-transcriptional gene regulation from all aspects.

item.title: CSEM (ChIP-Seq multi-read allocation using Expectation-Maximization)
item.description:
As one of the first ChIP-Seq multi-mapping read allocators, CSEM allows multi-reads to be utilized by peak callers.

item.title: RSEM (RNA-Seq by Expectation-Maximization)
item.description:
RSEM is a widely-used RNA-Seq transcript quantification tool. RSEM papers are cited over 5,300 times. It was served in nationwide consortium projects such as ENCODE (The Encyclopedia of DNA Elements) and TCGA (The Cancer Genome Altas). It is also recommended by HCA (Human Cell Atlas) for analyzing plate-based SMART-Seq2 single-cell RNA-Seq data.

Publications:

  • RSEM algorithm
  • RSEM software
